cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 250 mi WSW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: moving east-northeast toward the Cayman Islands and Cuba, then forecast to turn north-northwest and approach the Florida Keys/South Florida before bending west-northwest over the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward Florida’s Big Bend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys or extreme South Florida

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch is posted only from Sebastian Inlet FL southward around the peninsula, not as far north as South Carolina
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings limited to Cayman Islands, parts of Cuba, and the north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba, the north-western Bahamas, Florida Keys, South Florida and eventually Florida’s Gulf coast up to the Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm force winds are unlikely; cumulative probability only 5% over the next five days
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Charleston given the forecast track and offshore wind orientation
weather_observation.rainfall: Only light fringe showers possible mid-week; heavy tropical rainfall is not expected to reach the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip-current risk along the South Carolina coast late in the period
